p: Downpours had a significant effect on the temperature of the leaf surface ( F 3,20 = 10.5, P < 0.001) and temperature depended on the time point that it was measured ( F 6, 253 = 36.2, P < 0.001). In response to downpours, the temperature immediately dropped by approximately 5°C and it took at least an hour to return to the original temperature (Appendix S1: Fig. S1).
